baseline_groups.claim_summary: The Juventud en Accion vocational training program increases formal sector income for disadvantaged youth in Colombia.
baseline_groups.notes: Two baselines for the same estimand on two independent samples: Entire Cohort (EC) and Evaluation Sample (ES).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: The Juventud en Accion vocational training program increases formal sector employment for disadvantaged youth in Colombia.
baseline_groups.notes: Formal employment (binary indicator) is one of the paper primary outcomes. EC and ES samples both test the same claim.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: The Juventud en Accion vocational training program increases employment in large formal firms for disadvantaged youth in Colombia.
baseline_groups.notes: Large firm employment (N200) is a secondary primary outcome. EC and ES both test the same claim.

global_notes: 6 baseline specs for 3 outcomes x 2 samples. Many robustness specs are exact duplicates of baselines re-labeled under different categories. Displacement interaction specs test a different causal object. Balance tests are diagnostic. Heterogeneity by gender are subgroup analyses. Data extracted from log files.
